subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit considered problematic
msgSnippet: You did not ask questions. You offered inflammatory uninformed opinion. I recommend you learn the difference. So said javainsel on 4/4/2003
messageBody:
You did not ask questions. You offered inflammatory uninformed opinion.

I recommend you learn the difference.

So said javainsel on 4/4/2003 --------------------
> Nilesh:
>
> With all due respect, I don't like anyone -- ANYONE -- saying
silly things like "JUnit considered problematic" and having zero
experience to back it up. That's just ridiculous. That is what is
immature.
>
> If you show a lack of maturity, it becomes infectious. That's
human nature.
>
> It's not about emotional involvement; it's about people making
claims they have no business making that make us look bad. I just
don't see why we should accept that.
>
> Take care.

I had enough information and frustration about JUnit/TDD to start a
discussion.

Many Universities researched for testing methods. Many academics
don't seem to like JUnit/TDD paradigma.

First I thought that this is only academic.

But then I found a commercial tool (JTest) which seems to exactly do
what I was looking for.

Everything must be questioned. Otherwise no progress is possible.
